technologies.name: Sentry
technologies.description: Sentry is an open-source platform for workflow productivity, aggregating errors from across the stack in real time.

technologies.name: Node.js
technologies.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

technologies.name: SvelteKit
technologies.description: SvelteKit is the official Svelte framework for building web applications with a flexible filesystem-based routing.

technologies.name: Svelte
technologies.description: Svelte is a free and open-source front end compiler created by Rich Harris and maintained by the Svelte core team members.

technologies.name: Matomo Analytics
technologies.description: Matomo Analytics is a free and open-source web analytics application, that runs on a PHP/MySQL web-server.

technologies.name: Crisp Live Chat
technologies.description: Crisp Live Chat is a live chat solution with free and paid options.

technologies.name: HSTS
technologies.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS.

technologies.name: Vite
technologies.description: Vite is a rapid development tool for modern web projects.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

seo.title: SEO
seo.description: These checks ensure that your page is following basic search engine optimization advice. There are many additional factors Lighthouse does not score here that may affect your search ranking, including performance on [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/learn-web-vitals/). [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
seo.manualDescription: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.

pwa.title: PWA
pwa.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).
pwa.manualDescription: These checks are required by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist) but are not automatically checked by Lighthouse. They do not affect your score but it's important that you verify them manually.

technologies.name: WordPress
technologies.description: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database. Features include a plugin architecture and a template system.

technologies.name: MySQL
technologies.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system.

technologies.name: PHP
technologies.description: PHP is a general-purpose scripting language used for web development.

technologies.name: Hello Elementor
technologies.description: Hello Elementor is a WordPress theme built for the Elementor website builder platform. It uses minimal styling and scripts for maximum speed and design freedom.

technologies.name: Elementor
technologies.description: Elementor is a website builder platform for professionals on WordPress.

technologies.name: Backbone.js
technologies.description: BackboneJS is a JavaScript library that allows to develop and structure the client side applications that run in a web browser.

technologies.name: Yoast SEO
technologies.description: Yoast SEO is a search engine optimisation plugin for WordPress and other platforms.

technologies.name: Underscore.js
technologies.description: Underscore.js is a JavaScript library which provides utility functions for common programming tasks. It is comparable to features provided by Prototype.js and the Ruby language, but opts for a functional programming design instead of extending object prototypes.

technologies.name: Cloudflare Browser Insights
technologies.description: Cloudflare Browser Insights is a tool that measures the performance of websites from the perspective of users.

technologies.name: Cloudflare Bot Management
technologies.description: Cloudflare bot management solution identifies and mitigates automated traffic to protect websites from bad bots.

technologies.name: Matomo Analytics
technologies.description: Matomo Analytics is a free and open-source web analytics application, that runs on a PHP/MySQL web-server.

technologies.name: Lodash
technologies.description: Lodash is a JavaScript library which provides utility functions for common programming tasks using the functional programming paradigm.

technologies.name: jQuery UI
technologies.description: jQuery UI is a collection of GUI widgets, animated visual effects, and themes implemented with jQuery, Cascading Style Sheets, and HTML.

technologies.name: jQuery Migrate
technologies.description: Query Migrate is a javascript library that allows you to preserve the compatibility of your jQuery code developed for versions of jQuery older than 1.9.

technologies.name: jQuery
technologies.description: jQuery is a JavaScript library which is a free, open-source software designed to simplify HTML DOM tree traversal and manipulation, as well as event handling, CSS animation, and Ajax.

technologies.name: core-js
technologies.description: core-js is a modular standard library for JavaScript, with polyfills for cutting-edge ECMAScript features.

technologies.name: Crisp Live Chat
technologies.description: Crisp Live Chat is a live chat solution with free and paid options.

technologies.name: Swiper
technologies.description: Swiper is a JavaScript library that creates modern touch sliders with hardware-accelerated transitions.

technologies.name: Sendinblue
technologies.description: Sendinblue is an email marketing solution for small and medium-sized businesses that want to send and automate email marketing campaigns.

technologies.name: Priority Hints
technologies.description: Priority Hints exposes a mechanism for developers to signal a relative priority for browsers to consider when fetching resources.

technologies.name: Calendly
technologies.description: Calendly is an app for scheduling appointments, meetings, and events.

technologies.name: Elementor Cloud
technologies.description: Elementor Cloud is a platform for creating and hosting WordPress websites with Elementor.

technologies.name: Cloudflare
technologies.description: Cloudflare is a web-infrastructure and website-security company, providing content-delivery-network services, DDoS mitigation, Internet security, and distributed domain-name-server services.

technologies.name: Webpack
technologies.description: Webpack is an open-source JavaScript module bundler.

technologies.name: RSS
technologies.description: RSS is a family of web feed formats used to publish frequently updated workssuch as blog entries, news headlines, audio, and videoin a standardized format.

technologies.name: Open Graph
technologies.description: Open Graph is a protocol that is used to integrate any web page into the social graph.

technologies.name: Module Federation
technologies.description: Module Federation is a webpack technology for dynamically loading parts of other independently deployed builds.

technologies.name: HTTP/3
technologies.description: HTTP/3 is the third major version of the Hypertext Transfer Protocol used to exchange information on the World Wide Web.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

There are many additional factors Lighthouse does not score here that may affect your search ranking, including performance on [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/learn-web-vitals/). technologies.name: Sentry
technologies.description: Sentry is an open-source platform for workflow productivity, aggregating errors from across the stack in real time.

technologies.name: Node.js
technologies.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, JavaScript runtime environment that executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

technologies.name: SvelteKit
technologies.description: SvelteKit is the official Svelte framework for building web applications with a flexible filesystem-based routing.

technologies.name: Svelte
technologies.description: Svelte is a free and open-source front end compiler created by Rich Harris and maintained by the Svelte core team members.

technologies.name: Matomo Analytics
technologies.description: Matomo Analytics is a free and open-source web analytics application, that runs on a PHP/MySQL web-server.

technologies.name: Crisp Live Chat
technologies.description: Crisp Live Chat is a live chat solution with free and paid options.

technologies.name: HSTS
technologies.description: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS) informs browsers that the site should only be accessed using HTTPS.

technologies.name: Vite
technologies.description: Vite is a rapid development tool for modern web projects.

accessibility.title: Accessibility
accessibility.description: These checks highlight opportunities to [improve the accessibility of your web app](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility). Only a subset of accessibility issues can be automatically detected so manual testing is also encouraged.
accessibility.manualDescription: These items address areas which an automated testing tool cannot cover. Learn more in our guide on [conducting an accessibility review](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/accessibility/how-to-review).

seo.title: SEO
seo.description: These checks ensure that your page is following basic search engine optimization advice. There are many additional factors Lighthouse does not score here that may affect your search ranking, including performance on [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/learn-web-vitals/). [Learn more](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/35769).
seo.manualDescription: Run these additional validators on your site to check additional SEO best practices.

pwa.title: PWA
pwa.description: These checks validate the aspects of a Progressive Web App. [Learn more](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist).
pwa.manualDescription: These checks are required by the baseline [PWA Checklist](https://developers.google.com/web/progressive-web-apps/checklist) but are not automatically checked by Lighthouse. They do not affect your score but it's important that you verify them manually.
